SECOND SLIPWAY - CONTINUOUS ACTION                       66 Dredger looks up at the approach of the propellers -- -- Holmes charges into Dredger again, pulling him backwards across the runners. Dredger pulls Holmes down with him, Holmes' head hits the ground hard. Holmes lies semi-conscious, eyes rolled back into his head, as the leviathan roars down towards him. The ground beneath him shakes, knocks his head against the runner -- once, twice -- as he blinks back into consciousness, he sees the great shadow sweeping over him. He's doomed. And... The stern lurches to a STOP INCHES from his face. He opens one tentative eye, half expecting to find himself in the after-life, and sees black metal an inch from his nose. He realizes the ship has stopped, but he doesn't know why. He tries to roll out of the way, as -- 66A                                                                66A EXT. SECOND SLIPWAY - CONTINUOUS ACTION We see the chain extended taut as a tight-rope behind the half-launched ship. The SHIP squeals and groans as its timber supports buckle and crack with the weight of the tethered ship. A beat where the whole business hangs in limbo and... The timber finally gives way.   The ship is free again, falling through the air -- Holmes rolls sideways as the propellers slice through the air above his head -- the hull screams past him with a sound like the side of the world being torn off -- -- and then the ship's away, parting the Thames with a vast, frothy explosion of water. Holmes watches the ship drift gracefully out into the river -- from vortex to serenity in a matter of seconds. A quiet beat. Holmes collapses back, great gulps of air disappearing into his lungs. He tries to pull himself to his feet, but Dredger's bone-shaking punches have taken it out of him and he sags back to the ground. Watson arrives, helps him to his feet. They stagger back to the slipway where Dredger was standing. And they find: (CONTINUED) 53. 66A   CONTINUED:

A giant holding cell where every shade and aspect of Victorian villainy is corralled. Holmes wakes up on a bench after a peaceful night's sleep. Watson sits next to him, exhausted, bloodshot eyes. He's reading his notebook, making the odd change here and there. Holmes looks up and sees Watson staring at him, shaking his head.

How could I ever be so deluded as to believe I could meet Mary's parents for tea once I let myself be talked into going with you. Now of course I'm in jail. direction.raw_text: The first time WAS an accident...

direction.raw_text: Remember me, boys? Put me away for robbery a few years back? Holmes turns and comes face-to-face with a dangerous- looking man who has a few conspicuous WARTS on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, Mr. Brownlee. The fifteenth most dangerous man in London. Watson snaps at the man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who could forget that face? I told you, a little nitrate of silver and the warts will be gone in two weeks. Now, if you'll excuse us! Brownlee takes a swing at Watson. Holmes checks him and drops Brownlee without missing a beat. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 67   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nor am I complaining about the fact that you terrorize my patients and perform outlandish experiments on my dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gladstone's my dog as well.   It's in the interest of science.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I do take issue with is your ruthless campaign to sabotage my relationship with Mary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watson, I completely understand now. You're overtired and feeling a bit sensitive. Watson now turns away, completely irritated at Holmes' lack of understanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you need is a rest. You and I could go out to the countryside. My brother Mycroft has a small estate near Chichester. It has marvelous grounds and a beautiful folly. We could throw a lamb on the spit. Watson shakes his head in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I were going to the country, I would be going with my future wife -- HOLMES Certainly. We should have her along. Let's get Gladstone out of the house as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Holmes. Not you.   Me and her. You're not -- HOLMES Invited? Now you're not making any sense, Watson. Why would I not be invited to my own brother's country home? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 67   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not human. You don't get it, do you? You are this... (touches his own head) ... without this. He touches his own heart.   They hear a BILLYCLUB hit the bars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John Watson?   You made bail. Watson steps up. Holmes looks confused.    He steps forward. But the Guard shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just Watson. As he slides open the bars, they see... MARY emerges from behind the Guard. Watson stands for a beat between Holmes and Mary. He must make a decision. And he does -- -- he leaves. Holmes watches him walk out, then locks eyes with Mary. She gives him a polite nod, turns, heads off with Watson. The bars slide shut. The mob surrounds Holmes.   He's never looked more alone. 68
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONDON JAIL - CORRIDOR Lestrade heads toward the holding room, flanked by prison wardens. (CONTINUED) 55. 68   CONTINUED:                                                   68 As the door is opened, the thug blasts out backwards, having just been battered through it by Holmes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lestrade -- your usual impeccable timing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, in another life, you'd have made an excellent criminal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you, sir, an excellent policeman. 69   EXT. LONDON JAIL - DAY                                       69 Holmes and Lestrade march along. Lestrade holds out a copy of the newspaper. The headline reads: "BLACKWOOD LIVES AND THE DEVIL WALKS WITH HIM! MURDERER RESURRECTED!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me you have answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All in good time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have time. I've an office full of policemen hanging crosses over their desks. A public that's working itself into a frenzy... Holmes sees a dark, strange carriage waiting, door open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try to behave yourself. They just paid a small fortune to bail you out. 70   OMITTED                                                      70 71   INT. CARRIAGE                                                71 Holmes enters.   An ANONYMOUS MAN sits in the other seat. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 71   CONTINUED:                                                      71 ANONYMOUS MAN I'm afraid you'll have to put this on. He holds a black hood.   Holmes shrugs. CUT TO BLACK. FADE IN: 72   INT. TEMPLE OF FOUR ORDERS HEADQUARTERS                         72 The hood is pulled off. Holmes takes in the scene, eyes flicking around the room. He's in a grand office where a man in his late 60s, SIR THOMAS, rises from a pile of papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Holmes, apologies for summoning you like this. I'm sure it's quite a mystery as to where you are, and who I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As to where I am -- I was, admittedly, lost for a moment between Charing Cross and Holborn. But I was saved by the bread shop on Saffron Hill, the only bakers to use a certain French glaze on their loaves. After that, the carriage forked left, then right, a bump over the Fleet conduit -- need I go on? Somewhat stunned, Sir Thomas shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As to who you are -- that took every ounce of my not- inconsiderable experience and skill... the letters on your desk are addressed to Sir Thomas Rotheram, Lord Chief Justice. That would be your official title. Who you realy are is another matter entirely. Sir Thomas is not in the mood for this -- but Holmes is on a roll. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 72   CONTINUED:                                                    72 HOLMES Judging by the sacred Ox on your ring, you're also the secret head of the Temple of the Four Orders -- in whose headquarters we now stand, on the northwest corner of St. James Square. (beat) And as to the mystery -- the mystery is why you bothered to blindfold me in the first place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, well, it's standard procedure, I suppose. Holmes shakes his head; what a massive lack of judgement on their part.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we have the right man. Holmes turns to see JOHN STANDISH and LORD COWARD standing behind him. Standish is an American in his sixties. Coward is a hard, ambitious man in his 30s. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 72   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherlock Holmes, Ambassador Standish from America and Lord Coward, the Home Secretary. Holmes acknowledges them -- barely -- as they enter.    He isn't impressed by rank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose you already have some notion as to the -- practices of our Order?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   They're almost interesting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be as skeptical as you like -- but our secret systems have steered the world towards the greater good for centuries. The danger is that they can also be exploited for more nefarious purposes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What some call the dark arts, or practical magic. Holmes looks around the room, sees FLAGS on the walls with ancient symbols, variations of the SPHINX.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We know you're are a rationalist. We don't ask you to share our faith, only our fears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fear is the more infectious condition. (at Sir Thomas) In this case, fear of your own child. That shocks them rigid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blackwood is your son, yes? You have the same colored irises -- a rare dark green, with diamond- shaped hazel flecks -- (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 72   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: plus identical outer ears, or pinna, which only pass down through the direct bloodline, which would make you either brothers, or, more likely, father and son. Stunned, the men consult silently, come to some sort of conclusion. They turn back to Holmes. Sir Thomas seems especially shaken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very few people are privy to that information, and we want to keep it that way. Sir Thomas opens a bureau, digs for something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was conceived during one of our rituals. His mother wasn't my wife, but she shared our beliefs. She was a powerful practitioner. Though not enough to survive giving birth to him. Holmes is appalled and shows it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were young. It was before we fully understood the powers we were dealing with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evidently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death followed him wherever he went, from his birth to arms he made and sold. What family he had tended to... not survive. No one could prove anything of course, but we all knew -- Sir Thomas hands Holmes a TINTYPE. A photograph from the 1860s. It's chilling: a death scene, a BODY covered by a sheet. A man who's just fallen out a window. A TEN- YEAR-OLD BOY -- young Lord Blackwood -- looks on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy was a curse. I didn't have the courage either to take him in or to -- (CONTINUED) 59. 72   CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All this is history. The present and future are worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've done our best to stop him ourselves, but it's not enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His power grows daily and exponentially. His resurrection is evidence of that. What he does next will be far more dangerous -- SIR THOMAS -- he's going to raise a force that will alter the very course of our world. We need you to find him and stop him before he does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll give you any assistance we can. As Home Secretary, I have considerable influence over the police. (beat) Name your price. Holmes looks at Coward with scathing disdain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the great benefits of my work is that I can pick and choose my clients. I'll get him, but not for you. Holmes stalks out -- stops at the door, turns, fixes Sir Thomas with a very bleak gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have one last question, Sir Thomas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? Holmes holds up the tintype.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If the rest of his family's dead, why are you still alive? Holmes tosses the tintype onto a table, leaves. 73
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 74   EXT. THE GRAND HOTEL                                        74 Holmes comes out of a carriage, and scoots up the steps of the massive hotel that's bustling with people. 75   INT. IRENE'S HOTEL ROOM - DAY                               75 Irene enters wearing a stunning evening dress. She pauses glancing briefly around the room before sitting at a mirrored dressing table. There's a decanter on the table next to her from which she pours herself a glass of wine. Then she begins removing an impressive assortment of WEAPONS hidden on her person: she pulls a stiletto from her garter, a Derringer from her waistband (which she puts down next to the wine glass). She pulls long thin needles from her hair, lets her hair down. As she continues... PULL BACK TO REVEAL Holmes watching her from a shadowy corner. He looks on silently until:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're going to watch me take my clothes off, Sherlock, the least you can do is help me with the buttons. OR ALT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To watch a lady undress without her permission is a criminal offense, Sherlock, and could get you into a lot of trouble... They both eye the Derringer on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why don't you come over here and help me instead. Holmes approaches her somewhat tentatively and reaches for the top button on the back of her dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can stop looking for Reardon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew I could count on you. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 75   CONTINUED:                                                     75 HOLMES He was buried in Blackwood's tomb. Irene is momentarily taken aback then recovers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wonderful. Case closed then. Your services are no longer required. Unbuttoning done, Holmes steps out to confront Irene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't help wondering if your employer will be as content with these results? You were uncharacteristically ill at ease in his presence. Your hand was trembling, your gaze was averted. I couldn't see his face, but I spotted chalk on his lapel. A professor perhaps? Irene gets up, walks behind a DRESSING SCREEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The eye patch was a nice touch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I've never known a professor to carry a gun, and on such a clever contraption.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's not argue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not. Irene steps out, now wearing an array of Victorian undergarments. Unfairly gorgeous. The huge DIAMOND still around her neck. She moves back to the dressing table. Holmes won't look at her, refusing to get turned on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me who you're working for and what he's after.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's nobody's business but my own. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 75   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I disagree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see, we are arguing. Holmes gets closer and closer to Irene as he presses his case vehemently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When a man you ask me to find ends up dead in the coffin of the most notorious murderer since Jack the Ripper and that murderer manages to return from the dead, not only is it my business, it's the business of Scotland Yard and the highest levels of the British government. They will certainly consider your reticence to be an obstruction of justice. Which in relation to a crime of this magnitude would certainly mean prison time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This wine is excellent.    You should really try some. Holmes notices her Derringer on the table next to the wine bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's it to be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do we really have to decide now? Irene reaches for the wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in over your head this time, Irene. Irene snatches up her gun.    Holmes grabs her arm. BANG! A BULLET tears into his shoe, missing his toe. Holmes snatches away the smoking Derringer. Irene kisses him, hard and angry at first, becoming something else. Another of the weapons in her arsenal, and the one that disarms Holmes. The kiss leads them to the bed. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 75   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's better. Irene pulls him down to it.     He doesn't resist. CLICK! Holmes' eyes flare with surprise. CLICK!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Much better. Irene has handcuffed him to the bed frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the only way it could ever work between us, Sherlock -- one in shackles, the other with the key. She gets off him. While he struggles on the bed, Irene walks casually across the room. She starts putting on MAN'S CLOTHING. She's in charge now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've NEVER been in over my head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you live like this -- always a fugitive. She approaches, now dressed as a man, straddles him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But free. And on my own terms. Just like you -- well, not you at this exact moment -- (CONTINUED) 63. 75    CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pulls at the front of his trousers, throws the handcuff keys down there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but generally speaking. Holmes has no retort. Irene takes the scarf off his neck, moves to the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If anyone asks, please let them know that Mr. O'Neil didn't have time to check out. (beat) I hope you don't mind settling the bill. OR ALT:

The CAMERA SLOWLY TRACKS IN, drip, drip, drip. The silence is broken all of a sudden when the tap is magically turned on. Sir Thomas opens his eyes in panic, as he hears an eerie WHISPER O.S., like the rushing of wind. Sir Thomas is overcome with panic, tries to sit up. Can't. Not all the way. (CONTINUED) 64. 77    CONTINUED:                                                   77 BLACKWOOD (O.S.) Hello, Father... Thomas blinks and sees that BLACKWOOD now sits in the corner of the bathroom, lit in a sinister fashion. Sir Thomas' eyes widen, the muscles stand out in his neck as he fights paralysis. He slides back down, slowly.

direction.raw_text: You can't fight it. It comes from a power greater than yours. You can only surrender. The water flows over Sir Thomas, as Blackwood steps closer and takes the sacred RING from his rigid finger.

Clothes in total disarray. Her shriek wakes him. He looks down at himself and reacts with shock, then grim recognition sets in.
